intro: [WRONG START] Rubus pericolous, commonly known as the deadly raspberry, is a shrub native to parts of North America. It is characterized by its thorny stems and clusters of small, red, edible berries. The plant belongs to the Rosaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like roses and strawberries. Despite its attractive appearance, it can be toxic if consumed in large quantities. Its botanical features make it both a notable and potentially hazardous species in its native habitat.
